page.title: 07SILK WILLOUGHBY PUBLIC HOUSE
page.content: {The Horseshoes}was once known as The Three Horseshoes. The pub has a {restaurant}with seating for 38 people. The present owner, Francisco Cunago, has been in{Silk Willoughby}just over three years. The restaurant is also used for{wedding receptions}and {parties. {Egon Ronay}included the Horseshoes in the{1984-5 Good Food Guide. Francisco Cunago and his wife won the{Pub Caterer of the Year {Competition.}They won Â£300 worth of advertising, three nights in the Grosvenor Hotel, London, and a trip on the Orient Express. Mr Cunago has changed the kitchen into a restaurant and the cellar into a kitchen. He believes that people of 30 or over drink more alcohol than younger people.
